Journal.Title: International journal of environmental research and public health
Journal.ISOAbbreviation: Int J Environ Res Public Health

Article.ArticleTitle: Urban Surface Ozone Concentration in Mainland China during 2015-2020: Spatial Clustering and Temporal Dynamics.

AbstractText: Urban ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) pollution in the atmosphere has become increasingly prominent on a national scale in mainland China, although the atmospheric particulate matter pollution has been significantly reduced in recent years. The clustering and dynamic variation characteristics of the O<sub>3</sub> concentrations in cities across the country, however, have not been accurately explored at relevant spatiotemporal scales. In this study, a standard deviational ellipse analysis and multiscale geographically weighted regression models were applied to explore the migration process and influencing factors of O<sub>3</sub> pollution based on measured data from urban monitoring sites in mainland China. The results suggested that the urban O<sub>3</sub> concentration in mainland China reached its peak in 2018, and the annual O<sub>3</sub> concentration reached 157 ± 27 μg/m<sup>3</sup> from 2015 to 2020. On the scale of the whole Chinese mainland, the distribution of O<sub>3</sub> exhibited spatial dependence and aggregation. On the regional scale, the areas of high O<sub>3</sub> concentrations were mainly concentrated in Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei, Shandong, Jiangsu, Henan, and other regions. In addition, the standard deviation ellipse of the urban O<sub>3</sub> concentration covered the entire eastern part of mainland China. Overall, the geographic center of ozone pollution has a tendency to move to the south with the time variation. The interaction between sunshine hours and other factors (precipitation, NO<sub>2</sub>, DEM, SO<sub>2</sub>, PM<sub>2.5</sub>) significantly affected the variation of urban O<sub>3</sub> concentration. In Southwest China, Northwest China, and Central China, the suppression effect of vegetation on local O<sub>3</sub> was more obvious than that in other regions. Therefore, this study clarified for the first time the migration path of the gravity center of the urban O<sub>3</sub> pollution and identified the key areas for the prevention and control of O<sub>3</sub> pollution in mainland China.
